title: language_test_4_4
feedback: The correct answer is "No change." The sentence should read: “When a circuit is connected to the anode and cathode, the electrons move through the circuit.”  The clause “when a circuit is connected to the anode and cathode” is a dependent clause. The word “when” shows that this clause can’t stand alone as a sentence. Using a period or a semicolon is incorrect. The dependent clause is a fragment. A comma after “electrons” is also incorrect. “Electrons” is the subject of the independent clause, and there should not be a comma between the subject and verb. There should be a comma after “cathode” to separate the dependent clause from the independent clause.
